text: Sam Tulya-Muhika is a Ugandan economist, playwright and diplomat. In 2012 he became the Ugandan Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Somalia.Why Museveni shook up his envoys, RDCs, The Observer, August 19, 2012. Accessed March 24, 2019. ==Works== * 'Born to Die'. In David Cook & Miles Lee, eds., Short East African Plays, Heinemann, 1968. * The report of the Public Service Salaries Review Commission, 1980-1982, 1982 * Wulida li-'l-maut, 1984 * A summary of the lessons from the rise and fall of the East African Community, 1995 * (with R. Chande and Francis A. S. T. Matambalya) Deepening East African Community (EAC) integration, 2007 ==References== Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Ugandan economists Category:Ugandan writers Category:Ugandan dramatists and playwrights Category:Ambassadors of Uganda Category:Ambassadors to Somalia
title: Sam Tulya-Muhika
